com.sessionm.api
Class SessionM

java.lang.Object
  com.sessionm.api.SessionM

public class SessionM
extends Object

Session M service interface.

Basic API usage

Following is the basic pattern of integrating Session M service within your application code:

  1. Start the service by calling startSession(Context, String) . Note that you will need to obtain a valid application ID from session M.
    It is strongly recommended to make this call when the application is initialized in Application.onCreate() method override. This ensures that the Session M service is managed in one place regardless of which application activity is started first and whether application is being resumed or restarted from scratch.
    To extend base application class you need to do the following:
    • Define class extending from Application and override Application.onCreate() method in which you start a session by calling startSession(Context, String).
    • In your manifest file add the following android:name="YourClassName" to <application> tag where YourClassName is the name of the custom application class.
  2. Ensure that each Activity that can present SessionM UI notifies the SessionM service about its lifecycle. This can be accomplished in two ways:
    • By having your application activity extend BaseActivity class.
    • If extending BaseActivity is not possible, by calling lifecycle methods onActivityStart(Activity), onActivityResume(Activity), onActivityPause(Activity) and onActivityStop(Activity) in corresponding methods of your application activity: Activity.onStart(), Activity.onResume(), Activity.onPause() and Activity.onStop().
  3. Log actions in appropriate places in your code calling logAction(String) or BaseActivity.logAction(String). If the user earns an achievement as a result of action logging a pop-up is automatically displayed in the current application activity. Automatic achievement display can be disabled by calling setAutopresentMode(boolean) with false. In this case, when it is ready to present an achievement UI, the application will need to call presentActivity(ActivityType, Object...) with SessionM.ActivityType.ACHIEVEMENT.

Session Lifecycle

A session is started in the following two cases:

  1. When application explicitly calls startSession(Context, String) from, for example, Application.onCreate() override. This typically happens when application is first started.
  2. When application activity extending BaseActivity or calling Android activity life cycle methods such as onActivityStart(Activity) is brought in the foreground. This happens when application is foregrounded.
The session is automatically timed out when the application goes into the background.

Session M UI Activities

SessionM presents achievements and other information, such as user portal or SessionM program introduction via UI activity API - presentActivity(ActivityType, Object...). The types of Session M UI activities are defined in SessionM.ActivityType enum. Achievement activities become available as a result of action logging. User portal and program introduction activities are always available for display. Note that depending on the type of the Session M activity the UI may be presented either in application activity that is currently displayed by adding SessionM View to it or by launching a separate activity instance.

Event Notifications

To get notified about session and Session M UI events application can register SessionListener and ActivityListener by calling setSessionListener(SessionListener) and setActivityListener(ActivityListener) respectively. Alternatively, application activity can just extend BaseActivity or implement interfaces SessionListener and ActivityListener in which case the activity will get called with appropriate notifications automatically - SessionM service checks if activities registered via lifecycle notification methods implement relevant interfaces and calls them accordingly.

Threading

The SessionM class is thread-safe and can be invoked from any thread. Listener callback methods for ActivityListener and SessionListener are, by default, called on main application thread. The application can choose to use a different thread for listener calls in which case it needs to supply appropriate Handler instance using #setHandler(Handler) method.

Logging

SessionM logging output is available in Logcat under the tag 'SessionM' - it provides information about basic SDK actions such as session and UI events.
For example, to enable debug logging run the following ADB command: adb shell setprop log.tag.SessionM DEBUG.

Manifest

Ensure that the following entries are included in the application manifest file: 

 <activity
     android:name="com.sessionm.ui.SessionMActivity"
     android:launchMode="standard"
     android:theme="@android:style/Theme.Translucent"
     android:configChanges="keyboard|orientation|screenSize"
     android:windowContentOverlay="@null"
     android:windowFullscreen="true"
     android:windowIsTranslucent="true"
     android:windowNoTitle="false" >
 </activity>
 <receiver android:name="com.sessionm.cpi.PackageReceiver"/>

Permissions

Ensure that the following permissions are included in the application manifest file:

  • INTERNET

The following permissions may be optionally included to improve the user's SessionM experience:
  • ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE - used for optimizing our content on different networks
  • READ_PHONE_STATE - used for retrieving device information and for install tracking
  • ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION - used targeting ads to specific locations.
  • ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION - used targeting ads to specific locations.

isNewAchievementAvailable

public boolean isNewAchievementAvailable()
Returns true if new achievement has been earned is available for claiming, false - otherwise. Application can use this property to determine if newly available achievement should be presented via #presentActivity(ActivityType.ACHIEVEMENT) call. Once achievement popup has been presented the new achievement available flag is reset to false.

Returns:
boolean new achievement available flag

handler - Handler object, should not be null

dismissActivity

public void dismissActivity()
Dismisses activity.

logAction

public void logAction(String action)
Logs action and dislpays an achievement activity, if available and provided autopresent mode is on (the default). To disable autopresent mode call setAutopresentMode(boolean) with false. When autopresent mode is disabled application will need to call presentActivity(ActivityType, Object...) with SessionM.ActivityType.ACHIEVEMENT to display Session M achievement UI.

Parameters:
action - action name

setMetaData

public void setMetaData(Map<String,String> metaData)
Sends application specific meta data to Session M service.

Parameters:
metaData -

getUser

public User getUser()
Returns user info object representing user state. Note that during session lifecycle user info will likely change due to, for example, new achievements. These changes will be communicated using SessionListener.onUserUpdated(SessionM, User) callback.

Returns:
User user object
